SPOM.content: there is no Dasein of the specter

HERP.content: the voice, acc. Heidegger, is essentially marked, like everything at opening of Dasein, by Stimmung and Befindlichkeit—tonality, modality that is affective (not Heidegger’s words)
HERP.linkedContent: the voice, acc. Heidegger, is essentially marked, like everything at opening of Dasein, by Stimmung and Befindlichkeit—tonality, modality that is affective (not Heidegger’s words)

HERP.content: as Dasein throws itself by anticipation toward death, it inherits & chooses, chooses the very possibility of inheritance (Kampf belongs to very structure of Dasein)
HERP.linkedContent: as Dasein throws itself by anticipation toward death, it inherits & chooses, chooses the very possibility of inheritance (Kampf belongs to very structure of Dasein)

HERP.content: Dasein (Dasein’s ear) is beside what is heard [see What Poets are For?], carries beside itself (bei sich) the voice of the friend > all depends on semantics of bei, beside, auprès de: neither very close nor infinitely distant
HERP.linkedContent: Dasein (Dasein’s ear) is beside what is heard [see What Poets are For?], carries beside itself (bei sich) the voice of the friend > all depends on semantics of bei, beside, auprès de: neither very close nor infinitely distant

A.content: ontology of Dasein superordinate (vorgeordneten) to ontology of life [hierarchy in Heidegger]
A.linkedContent: ontology of Dasein superordinate (vorgeordneten) to ontology of life [hierarchy in Heidegger]

A.content: Heidegger: “Daisen never perishes (verendet nie), Dasein, however, can demise (ableben) only as long as it is dying (solange, als es stirbt)”
A.linkedContent: Heidegger: “Daisen never perishes (verendet nie), Dasein, however, can demise (ableben) only as long as it is dying (solange, als es stirbt)”

A.content: Heidegger’s distinction btwn sterben and verenden not irreconcilable w/ Freud’s thought re: fact that our mortality via death drive isn’t testified by science, our beliefs or the unconscious
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s distinction btwn sterben and verenden not irreconcilable w/ Freud’s thought re: fact that our mortality via death drive isn’t testified by science, our beliefs or the unconscious

A.content: does distinction btwn demise and dying avoid Levinas’ objection to Heidegger re: “mineness” of dying > in dying proper and properly speaking, no one can die for the other
A.linkedContent: does distinction btwn demise and dying avoid Levinas’ objection to Heidegger re: “mineness” of dying > in dying proper and properly speaking, no one can die for the other

A.content: that Dasein knows no end in sense of verenden, that it can only only perish as animal but not as Dasein, implies Dasein is immortal in its originary being-to-death
A.linkedContent: that Dasein knows no end in sense of verenden, that it can only only perish as animal but not as Dasein, implies Dasein is immortal in its originary being-to-death

A.content: Heidegger: all thoughts of demise presuppose an anthropological (historical) or biological (natural) concept of death, which existential analytic of Dasein seeks to correct
A.linkedContent: Heidegger: all thoughts of demise presuppose an anthropological (historical) or biological (natural) concept of death, which existential analytic of Dasein seeks to correct

A.content: existential analytic precedes, and is presupposed by other discourses of death, and founds (fundiert) them
A.linkedContent: existential analytic precedes, and is presupposed by other discourses of death, and founds (fundiert) them

A.content: “lived experience” is a ridiculous translation of Erlebnis (the measure of phenomenology) > how does it relate to Bezeugung (testimony)? Dasein never has the Erleben of its own demise (Ableben) but can testify to it, acc. Heidegger
A.linkedContent: “lived experience” is a ridiculous translation of Erlebnis (the measure of phenomenology) > how does it relate to Bezeugung (testimony)? Dasein never has the Erleben of its own demise (Ableben) but can testify to it, acc. Heidegger

A.content: universality of existential analysis of death (primitives have access to Dasein)
A.linkedContent: universality of existential analysis of death (primitives have access to Dasein)

A.content: “ontico-ontological priority of Dasein,” “exemplary” point of departure of existential analytic of Dasein, power of question of we, we here, that can listen wait for each other
A.linkedContent: “ontico-ontological priority of Dasein,” “exemplary” point of departure of existential analytic of Dasein, power of question of we, we here, that can listen wait for each other

A.content: Heidegger places analytic of Dasein re: death here, on this side, before all ontical speculation operating beyond (ultra, meta, trans), by way of an uncontested, irrecusable decision (a performative incision) on the undecidable question of “here”: a testimony w/out proof
A.linkedContent: Heidegger places analytic of Dasein re: death here, on this side, before all ontical speculation operating beyond (ultra, meta, trans), by way of an uncontested, irrecusable decision (a performative incision) on the undecidable question of “here”: a testimony w/out proof

A.content: only way for existential analytic of Dasein to achieve universality, must be only discipline where death knows no borders
A.linkedContent: only way for existential analytic of Dasein to achieve universality, must be only discipline where death knows no borders

A.content: Heidegger suggests diagnosis of problematic closures, they forget essence of Dasein, lock Dasein into ontological determination that is not its own, that of Vorhandensein
A.linkedContent: Heidegger suggests diagnosis of problematic closures, they forget essence of Dasein, lock Dasein into ontological determination that is not its own, that of Vorhandensein

A.content: “if being-possible is the being proper to Dasein, then the existential analysis of the death of Dasein will have to make of this possibility its theme” > death is possibility par excellence, exemplarily guides existential analysis
A.linkedContent: “if being-possible is the being proper to Dasein, then the existential analysis of the death of Dasein will have to make of this possibility its theme” > death is possibility par excellence, exemplarily guides existential analysis

A.content: for Heidegger, only w/ death does one await oneself, expect oneself > Dasein stretches (se tend), bends toward (se tend vers), offers to itself (se tend), offers it to itself (se le tend) ——for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]
A.linkedContent: for Heidegger, only w/ death does one await oneself, expect oneself > Dasein stretches (se tend), bends toward (se tend vers), offers to itself (se tend), offers it to itself (se le tend) ——for Heidegger, death—stand before (steht bevor) oneself, await, precede oneself as before a mirror, as before the future, “in its ownmost potentiality for being” [see p. 78]

A.content: Dasein takes shelter from standing before oneself [in anxiety of death] in gossip (Gerede), far from Unheimlichkeit, structural not accidental modes of Verfallen ——Derrida notes that, for Heidegger, the certainty of death is heterogenous to any other form of certainty, that when one speaks of dying it occurs at limits of truth and untruth
A.linkedContent: Dasein takes shelter from standing before oneself [in anxiety of death] in gossip (Gerede), far from Unheimlichkeit, structural not accidental modes of Verfallen ——Derrida notes that, for Heidegger, the certainty of death is heterogenous to any other form of certainty, that when one speaks of dying it occurs at limits of truth and untruth

A.content: Derrida introduces the often cited: death is for Dasein the possibility of an impossibility
A.linkedContent: Derrida introduces the often cited: death is for Dasein the possibility of an impossibility

A.content: existential analysis as witness, belonging w/out belonging of testimony, and first of all to language
A.linkedContent: existential analysis as witness, belonging w/out belonging of testimony, and first of all to language

EM.content: Sartre countersigned Corbin’s monstrous translation of Dasein: “réalité-humaine” > w/ Sartre and others of this period, concept of man is never examined
EM.linkedContent: Sartre countersigned Corbin’s monstrous translation of Dasein: “réalité-humaine” > w/ Sartre and others of this period, concept of man is never examined

EM.content: though Dasein not simply man of metaphysics, everything in Letter on Humanism and beyond returns to “proper of man,” guided by concept of proximity
EM.linkedContent: though Dasein not simply man of metaphysics, everything in Letter on Humanism and beyond returns to “proper of man,” guided by concept of proximity

EM.content: for Heidegger, Dasein entity w/ which to interpret Being, and which questions it; Dasein not consciousness like in transcendental phenomenology
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Dasein entity w/ which to interpret Being, and which questions it; Dasein not consciousness like in transcendental phenomenology

EM.content: exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum
EM.linkedContent: exemplary being is “phenomenological,” governed by principle of principles, i.e. presence and presence in self-presence, manifested in being we are, such proximity determines factum

EM.content: reading of text Dasein is a hermeneutics > if one looks closely, phenomenological opposition “implicit/explicit” permits Heidegger to avoid vicious circle (posing question of Being on basis of ontological predetermination)
EM.linkedContent: reading of text Dasein is a hermeneutics > if one looks closely, phenomenological opposition “implicit/explicit” permits Heidegger to avoid vicious circle (posing question of Being on basis of ontological predetermination)

EM.content: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being, l’homme reste le lien ou le fil conducteur paléonymique that ties analytic of Dasein to totality of metaphysical tradition
EM.linkedContent: Dasein serves as exemplary text to read Being, l’homme reste le lien ou le fil conducteur paléonymique that ties analytic of Dasein to totality of metaphysical tradition

EM.content: “on voit donc que le Dasein, s’il n’est pas l’homme, n’est pourtant pas autre chose que l’homme”
EM.linkedContent: “on voit donc que le Dasein, s’il n’est pas l’homme, n’est pourtant pas autre chose que l’homme”

EM.content: for Heidegger, motif of proximity caught in opposition which unceasingly regulates his discourse: in proximity of ontic, ontological Dasein is that which is farthest
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, motif of proximity caught in opposition which unceasingly regulates his discourse: in proximity of ontic, ontological Dasein is that which is farthest

EM.content: Da of Dasein signifies near as much as far
EM.linkedContent: Da of Dasein signifies near as much as far

EM.content: for Heidegger, restoration of essence of dignity, of proximity to Being, is done for Being and honor of Dasein, not for civilization or culture
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, restoration of essence of dignity, of proximity to Being, is done for Being and honor of Dasein, not for civilization or culture

EM.content: Derrida explains reason for Heidegger’s “metaphorics of proximity”: “the ontological distance from Dasein to what Dasein is as ek-sistence and to the Da of Sein, the distance that first was given as ontic proximity, must be reduced by the thinking of the truth of Being”
EM.linkedContent: Derrida explains reason for Heidegger’s “metaphorics of proximity”: “the ontological distance from Dasein to what Dasein is as ek-sistence and to the Da of Sein, the distance that first was given as ontic proximity, must be reduced by the thinking of the truth of Being”

EM.content: predominance of ontological proximity, man dwells in nearness, lighting of the Da, dwells as ek-sisting (ecstatic dwelling in nearness of Being, contrasts existentia, existence)
EM.linkedContent: predominance of ontological proximity, man dwells in nearness, lighting of the Da, dwells as ek-sisting (ecstatic dwelling in nearness of Being, contrasts existentia, existence)

S.content: Dasein is exemplary because of the experience of the question; privileged entity for a reading of Being
S.linkedContent: Dasein is exemplary because of the experience of the question; privileged entity for a reading of Being

S.content: how else but by confirming it a priori and circularly can Heidegger question Dasein’s privilege (Vorrang) re: the question?
S.linkedContent: how else but by confirming it a priori and circularly can Heidegger question Dasein’s privilege (Vorrang) re: the question?

S.content: spirit, soul, psyche, consciousness, ego, reason, subject block interrogation of Being of Dasein; the Jemeinigkeit of Dasein is not ego, not Vorhandene, not indifferent to but cares for its Being
S.linkedContent: spirit, soul, psyche, consciousness, ego, reason, subject block interrogation of Being of Dasein; the Jemeinigkeit of Dasein is not ego, not Vorhandene, not indifferent to but cares for its Being

S.content: Dasein’s indifference (Indifferenz, Gleichgültigkeit) is only possible because Dasein is not in-different, cares about Being, indifference as everydayness (not negative), its Durchschnittlichkeit
S.linkedContent: Dasein’s indifference (Indifferenz, Gleichgültigkeit) is only possible because Dasein is not in-different, cares about Being, indifference as everydayness (not negative), its Durchschnittlichkeit

S.content: three forms of indifference: 1) stone, vorhandene entity 2) positive phenomenon of Dasein 3) paralyzing indifference, that of Descartes, substantializes a “who” as existing in form of Vorhandenheit > #2 and #3, however, are of the same capacity
S.linkedContent: three forms of indifference: 1) stone, vorhandene entity 2) positive phenomenon of Dasein 3) paralyzing indifference, that of Descartes, substantializes a “who” as existing in form of Vorhandenheit > #2 and #3, however, are of the same capacity

S.content: Heidegger’s Destruktion of “spirit,” vulgar concept of time, Dasein’s substance is not spirit but existence
S.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Destruktion of “spirit,” vulgar concept of time, Dasein’s substance is not spirit but existence

S.content: Entschlossenheit (resolution) gives possible opening to Eigentlichkeit, authentic property of Dasein
for Heidegger, privation (Privation) in Dasein, in structure of “as,” structure of “something as something (die Struktur des Etwas als Etwas),” not same as animal’s privation (Entbehrung)
S.linkedContent: for Heidegger, privation (Privation) in Dasein, in structure of “as,” structure of “something as something (die Struktur des Etwas als Etwas),” not same as animal’s privation (Entbehrung)

OS.content: in analytic of Dasein, relation of fall to proper, authenticity, enigmatic proximity (identity w/ itself of the questioning), concept of finitude
OS.linkedContent: in analytic of Dasein, relation of fall to proper, authenticity, enigmatic proximity (identity w/ itself of the questioning), concept of finitude

ATIA.content: for Dasein to be in the world, for there to be world, must Dasein be-with-animal?
ATIA.linkedContent: for Dasein to be in the world, for there to be world, must Dasein be-with-animal?

ATIA.content: Dasein, a deconstruction of Cartesian subjectivity, but still anchored [inked] in “I am,” in Jemeinigkeit
ATIA.linkedContent: Dasein, a deconstruction of Cartesian subjectivity, but still anchored [inked] in “I am,” in Jemeinigkeit

DPi.content: instant of bandages, Christ’s being-there w/out being-there: this Dasein that is not a Da-sein, this Fort/Da-sein of Christ who’s dead but not dead, mort vivant
DPi.linkedContent: instant of bandages, Christ’s being-there w/out being-there: this Dasein that is not a Da-sein, this Fort/Da-sein of Christ who’s dead but not dead, mort vivant

DPi.content: for Heidegger, animal perishes (crève), only Dasein (human) dies, has right/possibility to die
DPi.linkedContent: for Heidegger, animal perishes (crève), only Dasein (human) dies, has right/possibility to die

RGE.content: Dasein translated as human-reality in Corbin’s French: monstrosity of unlimited consequences!
RGE.linkedContent: Dasein translated as human-reality in Corbin’s French: monstrosity of unlimited consequences!

Gi.content: insofar as it is open to the question of Being, Dasein would not be sexiferous (sexifère) [?]
Gi.linkedContent: insofar as it is open to the question of Being, Dasein would not be sexiferous (sexifère) [?]

Gi.content: Dasein, the there of Being, bears no sexual mark [?]
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein, the there of Being, bears no sexual mark [?]

Gi.content: list of general structures of Dasein: In-der-Welt Sein als Mit- und Selbstsein, Räumlichkeit, Befindlichkeit, Rede, Sprache, Geworfenheit, Sorge, Zeitlichkeit, Sein zum Tode
Gi.linkedContent: list of general structures of Dasein: In-der-Welt Sein als Mit- und Selbstsein, Räumlichkeit, Befindlichkeit, Rede, Sprache, Geworfenheit, Sorge, Zeitlichkeit, Sein zum Tode

Gi.content: Dasein: exemplary entity for the reading of the meaning of Being
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein: exemplary entity for the reading of the meaning of Being

Gi.content: justification of terminological choice Dasein—a predetermination only it can command > brutal, decisive declaration of name (Heidegger proceeds by decree)
Gi.linkedContent: justification of terminological choice Dasein—a predetermination only it can command > brutal, decisive declaration of name (Heidegger proceeds by decree)

Gi.content: Dasein more neutral than Mensch?; Dasein’s neutrality as neutralization/subtraction of everything but naked trait of this relation to self, to the Being of its being
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein more neutral than Mensch?; Dasein’s neutrality as neutralization/subtraction of everything but naked trait of this relation to self, to the Being of its being

Gi.content: Dasein’s neutrality as a certain sexlessness (Geschlechtsoloigkeit), sexual difference privileged anthropological trait to be neutralized; Heidegger: “Dasein is neither of the two sexes”
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein’s neutrality as a certain sexlessness (Geschlechtsoloigkeit), sexual difference privileged anthropological trait to be neutralized; Heidegger: “Dasein is neither of the two sexes”

Gi.content: Dasein’s neutrality makes possible concrete facticity of human, the analytic precedes “the existent,” not a philosophy of life
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein’s neutrality makes possible concrete facticity of human, the analytic precedes “the existent,” not a philosophy of life

Gi.content: ipseity of Dasein, its Selbstheit exists only for the sake of itself (but not egoism, consciousness)
Gi.linkedContent: ipseity of Dasein, its Selbstheit exists only for the sake of itself (but not egoism, consciousness)

Gi.content: analytic of Dasein must be protected from risks of anthropology, psychoanalysis, biology
Gi.linkedContent: analytic of Dasein must be protected from risks of anthropology, psychoanalysis, biology

Gi.content: Isolierung (metaphysical isolation) of Dasein, not a factical, existential solitude of man > and yet it does mean a certain isolation of man
Gi.linkedContent: Isolierung (metaphysical isolation) of Dasein, not a factical, existential solitude of man > and yet it does mean a certain isolation of man

Gi.content: Dasein must have body, bodiliness, prior to sexuality? Leiblichkeit draws Dasein into dispersion, thus into sexual difference? [see Gii pp. 38-9 Dasein as Leib]
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein must have body, bodiliness, prior to sexuality? Leiblichkeit draws Dasein into dispersion, thus into sexual difference? [see Gii pp. 38-9 Dasein as Leib]

Gi.content: Dasein always interacts w/ multiple objects, not because there are many but because of Dasein’s originary disseminal structure, its dispersion (Zerstreuung)
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein always interacts w/ multiple objects, not because there are many but because of Dasein’s originary disseminal structure, its dispersion (Zerstreuung)

Gi.content: Erstreckung: Dasein’s spatiality before extensio, se tend (tends, extends itself) btwn birth & death (Dasein affects itself w/ this movement, auto-affection belongs to ontological structure of Dasein’s historicality) > birth/death receive meaning from this intervallic movement > only one of determinate possibilities of essential dispersion (Zerstreuung)
Gi.linkedContent: Erstreckung: Dasein’s spatiality before extensio, se tend (tends, extends itself) btwn birth & death (Dasein affects itself w/ this movement, auto-affection belongs to ontological structure of Dasein’s historicality) > birth/death receive meaning from this intervallic movement > only one of determinate possibilities of essential dispersion (Zerstreuung)

Gi.content: “transcendental dispersion” belongs to essence of Dasein in its neutrality
Gi.linkedContent: “transcendental dispersion” belongs to essence of Dasein in its neutrality

Gi.content: it is the possibility of all dissociation in factical existence > dispersion is itself based on primordial feature Geworfenheit
Gi.linkedContent: it is the possibility of all dissociation in factical existence > dispersion is itself based on primordial feature Geworfenheit

Gi.content: Dasein is geworfen (thrown) before all modes of throwness that determine it
Gi.linkedContent: Dasein is geworfen (thrown) before all modes of throwness that determine it

Gi.content: thrownness can never be mastered (not a project of Dasein > also not passivity, which could reinscribe Dasein in active/passive subject(iv)ity)
Gi.linkedContent: thrownness can never be mastered (not a project of Dasein > also not passivity, which could reinscribe Dasein in active/passive subject(iv)ity)

Gi.content: not thrown into space, space depends on thrownness, before the Platonic or Christian image of the fall
Gi.linkedContent: not thrown into space, space depends on thrownness, before the Platonic or Christian image of the fall

Gi.content: being-with does not arise from factical connection, a species-like unification (gattungshafte Zusammenstreben) “metaphysically presupposes” dissemination of Dasein, thus Mitsein
Gi.linkedContent: being-with does not arise from factical connection, a species-like unification (gattungshafte Zusammenstreben) “metaphysically presupposes” dissemination of Dasein, thus Mitsein

Gi.content: ontology of life requires a “privative interpretation” [could one speak of a method?]; in Heidegger, life is neither pure Vorhandensein nor Dasein: what is life, then?
Gi.linkedContent: ontology of life requires a “privative interpretation” [could one speak of a method?]; in Heidegger, life is neither pure Vorhandensein nor Dasein: what is life, then?

Gi.content: dispersion marks most general structure of Dasein > yet elsewhere dispersion and distraction characterize inauthentic ipseity of Dasein (Man-selbst)
Gi.linkedContent: dispersion marks most general structure of Dasein > yet elsewhere dispersion and distraction characterize inauthentic ipseity of Dasein (Man-selbst)

Gi.content: dispersion marked twice (same could be said for neutral): general structure of Dasein & mode of inauthenticity
Gi.linkedContent: dispersion marked twice (same could be said for neutral): general structure of Dasein & mode of inauthenticity

Gi.content: for Heidegger, no properly sexual predicate > none that doesn’t refer back to general structure of Dasein: inside/outside, dispersion & proximity, here & there, birth & death…
Gi.linkedContent: for Heidegger, no properly sexual predicate > none that doesn’t refer back to general structure of Dasein: inside/outside, dispersion & proximity, here & there, birth & death…

Gii.content: savage second blow of sexual difference, its Verwesung, vs. originary, tender sexual difference > Heidegger claims this schema is not Christian/Platonic, but it has no other content and even no other language than Platonism/Christianity > its archi-matinal origin, ultra-Western horizon, constituted by hollow of a repetition, same for Verfall, Ruf, Sorge in structure of Dasein
Gii.linkedContent: savage second blow of sexual difference, its Verwesung, vs. originary, tender sexual difference > Heidegger claims this schema is not Christian/Platonic, but it has no other content and even no other language than Platonism/Christianity > its archi-matinal origin, ultra-Western horizon, constituted by hollow of a repetition, same for Verfall, Ruf, Sorge in structure of Dasein

REST.content: Da of Dasein (its proximity) lets distance of fort play w/in it
REST.linkedContent: Da of Dasein (its proximity) lets distance of fort play w/in it

HLP.content: Dasein: “bears w/in it self the possibilities of deceit & lying”
HLP.linkedContent: Dasein: “bears w/in it self the possibilities of deceit & lying”

EW.content: Dasein can’t be reduced to a subjectivity but existential analytic retains formal traits of every transcendental analytic [Heidegger & Kant]
EW.linkedContent: Dasein can’t be reduced to a subjectivity but existential analytic retains formal traits of every transcendental analytic [Heidegger & Kant]

EW.content: Derrida believes in certain irreversibility of replacing subject w/ Dasein, though Dasein is still too marked by vorhanden, thus time—the ontological structure is insufficiently questioned
EW.linkedContent: Derrida believes in certain irreversibility of replacing subject w/ Dasein, though Dasein is still too marked by vorhanden, thus time—the ontological structure is insufficiently questioned

EW.content: “we” of Dasein, we who are open to the question, to relation to self, to what is lacking in everything that’s not Dasein: this is analogous “logic” to what Heidegger sought to deconstruct
EW.linkedContent: “we” of Dasein, we who are open to the question, to relation to self, to what is lacking in everything that’s not Dasein: this is analogous “logic” to what Heidegger sought to deconstruct

EW.content: Da of Dasein singularizes itself w/out being reducible to any categories of human subjectivity (self, rational being, consciousness, person), because it is presupposed by all of these
EW.linkedContent: Da of Dasein singularizes itself w/out being reducible to any categories of human subjectivity (self, rational being, consciousness, person), because it is presupposed by all of these

SPEC.content: in both Freud & Heidegger, life death no longer opposed in the proper [both interpret death as proper? unlike Levinas & Derrida]
SPEC.linkedContent: in both Freud & Heidegger, life death no longer opposed in the proper [both interpret death as proper? unlike Levinas & Derrida]

SPEC.content: why would Dasein, “our own,” have to constitute itself as démarcheur [stockbroker, bad step]?
SPEC.linkedContent: why would Dasein, “our own,” have to constitute itself as démarcheur [stockbroker, bad step]?

SPEC.content: let me die properly: where death is my inheritance
SPEC.linkedContent: let me die properly: where death is my inheritance

SPEC.content: analytic of Da-sein (analytic of distance, proximity)—not so foreign to analysis of fort/da > economy of death, law of proper, auto-affection of fort:da, “eigenen Todesweg des Organismus”
SPEC.linkedContent: analytic of Da-sein (analytic of distance, proximity)—not so foreign to analysis of fort/da > economy of death, law of proper, auto-affection of fort:da, “eigenen Todesweg des Organismus”

SPEC.content: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s auto-affective structure of time, life as the auto-affection of death, differance lodged in desire (desire nothing but this) for this auto-tely: auto-delegates & arrives only by differing in tout autre [for Freud, life-death announced to serve the proper, an economy of death]

CHOR.content: Heidegger insists that Dasein is neuter, it is neutral, neither of the 2 sexes, but not indifferent, not annulling negativity—an originary positivity, Mächtigkeit des Wesens
CHOR.linkedContent: Heidegger insists that Dasein is neuter, it is neutral, neither of the 2 sexes, but not indifferent, not annulling negativity—an originary positivity, Mächtigkeit des Wesens
